page.title: 19The Grange Estate
page.content: Ebenezer Howard planned his Garden City to be self-contained with each house having its own garden, wide tree lined streets and surrounded by farm land. This lasted until after the 2nd World War, when the first of the Estates were built on the farm land at the edge of the town. This was started in 1948 and when the Grange School was opened in 1951 it was a well developed estate with many houses occupied. Now in 1985, the Grange Estate is the oldest, best established of the four estates ringing the town - a population of about 8,OOO - largely people buying what were previously council houses. It has a parade of shops, a community centre, a pub and two schools.There is an aging population on the Grange nowadays, and that will be a problem in the future.
